original: Bryntesson, Johan, direktör, Skara, f. 26/1/76 i Steneby, Älvsb. 1., av hem-m:äg. Brynte Jonasson o. Anna Jonas-dotter. G. 1. 03 m. Edelina KjeTlan-der, d. 40; 2. 43 m. Ingrid Faugust. Barn: Anna-Lisa f. 04, Amund 08, Birgit 13. — Deläg. i A-B Johan Löf-qvist Skofabr. i Gbg 08-12, disp. o. del-äg. i Sv. Skoind. A-B i Örebro 13-25, inneh. av samt verkst. dir. f. A-B J. Bryntesison & Co. Sikofebr. i Skara sed. 26. Äg. o. brukar St. Höbergs egend., N. Vånga. V. ordf. i Sv. skofabr : för en., iStyr :led. i Sko- o. läderbranschens fabr:- o. grossistfören. samt Sv:es skofabr. intressentfören., dir. i Skara Bostads A-B, ordf. i Västergötl. Tryckeri A-B o. i styr. f. Sv. Hand [-]bankens-] {+]ban- kens+} avd :kont. i Skara, huv :man i Skarab. Läns Sparbank, led. av drät-selkamm. sed. 29, stadsfullm. sed. 30 o. kyrkofullm. sed. 35, v. ordf. i folksk:-styr. sed. 38, led. av o. ordf. i lönend o. luftskind, kassaförv. i Skarab. mod. förb. RVO.
translated: Bryntesson, Johan, director, from Skara, born on January 26th, 1876 in Steneby, Älvsborgs län, son of homestead owners Brynte Jonasson and Anna Jonasdatter. He was first married in 1903 to Edelina Kjetlander who passed away in 1940. He married again in 1943 to Ingrid Faugust. They had three children: Anna-Lisa born in 1904, Amund born in 1908, and Birgit born in 1913. He was a co-owner in A-B Johan Löfqvist Skofabr. in Gothenburg from 1908-1912. He was a manager and co-owner in Sv. Skoind. A-B in Örebro from 1913-1925, and was the owner and managing director of A-B J. Bryntesson & Co. Skofebr. in Skara since 1926. He owned and operated St. Höbergs estate in N. Vånga. He was vice chairman for the Swedish Shoe Manufacturer's Association, a board member for the footwear and leather industry's manufacturing and wholesale association, as well as for the Swedish Shoe Manufacturer's Stakeholder Association. He was director in Skara Housing A-B, chairman of Västergötland Printing A-B, and on the board of the Swedish Handbanken's division office in Skara. He was chief executive of Skarab. County Savings Bank, a member of the city council since 1930, a member of the church council since 1935, vice chairman of the primary school board since 1938, a member and chairman of the wages and air defense committee and treasurer for Skarab. Modern Federation. He was awarded the RVO (Knight of Royal Order of Vasa).

memberOf.name: Footwear and Leather Industry's Manufacturing and Wholesale Association
